comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: I am assuming we are still in the 1913 tranche. But here is Dora Voight in 1916 at the Morristown, New Jersey show: Riders Injured At Morristown Show. Two Serious Accidents Mar the Opening of Field Club's Annual Exhibition. Source: New York Times; September 29, 1916 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9C04E5DD143BE633A... Here are the two images together: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4276180017/] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4276925550/] en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morristown_Field_Club

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: A Mrs William P Jenks of Morristown won second place at the September 1913 show for ponies under saddle, according to NYT of September 28, 1913 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=950CE0D8163DE633A... and NYT of September 26, 1913 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9905E2D9163DE633A... notes that Miss Dora W. Voight of Green Village, NJ, won the ponies in harness class (presumably what we are seeing here).
